page.title: 08THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: THE FIRST SCHOOL FOR THE CHILDREN OF MARCHWIEL WAS OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE AND HAD BEEN BUILT BY THE CHURCH IN WALES. AS THE VILLAGE GREW A LARGER SCHOOL WAS BUILT BY THE CHURCH, NEARLY OPPOSITE THE PARISH CHURCH, WITH A HOUSE FOR THE HEADMASTER ADDED TEN YEARS LATER. IN 1974, HOWEVER, THE PRESENT OPEN PLAN PRIMARY SCHOOL SITUATED AT THE RIDGEWAY WAS COMPLETED THE OLD BUILDING BEING SOLD TO THE LOCAL FURNISHING FIRM, SCOTTS. AS A RESULT OF A SURVEY OF PARENTS CARRIED OUT BY THE AUTHORITY IT WAS DECIDED THAT THE NEW SCHOOL SHOULD BE RUN INDEPENDENTLY OF THE CHURCH. THE SCHOOL MANAGERS DECIDED TO RETAIN THE 150 YEAR OLD LINK WITH THE CHURCH BY NAMING THE NEW SCHOOL AFTER ST DEINIOL TO WHOM THE CHURCH IS DEDICATED. HENCE, DEINIOL COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL.
